meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a mate or companion.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, the squirrel found comfort in the mateship of other animals.
meanings.sent2: The mateship between the two siblings was evident in their constant laughter and shared secrets.
meanings.sent3: The mateship among the toys in the playroom made the children giggle with joy.
meanings.sent4: The mateship of the stars in the night sky seemed to create a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The mateship of the puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together brought a sense of completion.

meanings.definition: The bond or friendship between mates.
meanings.sent1: The mateship between the two best friends was unbreakable.
meanings.sent2: The mateship of the teammates on the soccer field was evident in their coordinated plays.
meanings.sent3: The mateship between the books on the shelf made the library feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The mateship of the flowers in the garden created a colorful display.
meanings.sent5: The mateship of the puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together brought a sense of completion.

meanings.definition: The spirit of camaraderie and mutual support among friends.
meanings.sent1: During the camping trip, the mateship among the group helped them overcome challenges.
meanings.sent2: The mateship of the classmates was evident in their willingness to help each other with homework.
meanings.sent3: The mateship between the clouds in the sky made the sunset even more beautiful.
meanings.sent4: The mateship of the waves crashing against the shore created a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The mateship of the puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together brought a sense of completion.
